quote: The code you write today is the foundation of tomorrow's innovation.
author: Anonymous

quote: Bugs are just undocumented features waiting to be discovered.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
author: Cory House

quote: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

quote: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: It's not a bug – it's an undocumented feature.
author: Anonymous

quote: The expert in anything was once a beginner.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares.
author: Robert C. Martin

quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

quote: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
author: Dan Salomon

quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Code is like poetry; it's best when it's both concise and eloquent.
author: Anonymous

quote: The Internet? We are not interested in it.
author: Bill Gates (1993)

quote: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

quote: Don't comment bad code - rewrite it.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

quote: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
author: Anonymous

quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

quote: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: The best way to predict the future is to implement it.
author: David Heinemeier Hansson

quote: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Software and cathedrals are much the same — first we build them, then we pray.
author: Sam Redwine

quote: It's not a bug – it's an undocumented feature.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong you are only off by a bit.
author: Anonymous

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

quote: The best programmers are not marginally better than merely good ones. They are an order-of-magnitude better, measured by whatever standard: conceptual creativity, speed, ingenuity of design, or problem-solving ability.
author: Randall E. Stross

quote: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

quote: One man's crappy software is another man's full-time job.
author: Jessica Gaston

quote: It's harder to read code than to write it.
author: Joel Spolsky

quote: The greatest performance improvement of all is when a system goes from not-working to working.
author: John Ousterhout

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

quote: Today's programming is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it.
author: Pamela Zave

quote: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

quote: You might not think that programmers are artists, but programming is an extremely creative profession. It's logic-based creativity.
author: John Romero

quote: Programming is learned by writing programs.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: The most important single aspect of software development is to be clear about what you are trying to build.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: Programmers are not to be measured by their ingenuity and their logic but by the completeness of their case analysis.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: The best programmers are not marginally better than merely good ones. They are an order-of-magnitude better, measured by whatever standard: conceptual creativity, speed, ingenuity of design, or problem-solving ability.
author: Randall E. Stross

quote: Programming is the art of telling another human being what one wants the computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.
author: Jim Highsmith

quote: The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.
author: Tom Cargill

quote: In programming, the hard part isn't solving problems, but deciding what problems to solve.
author: Paul Graham

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: The only valid measurement of code quality: WTFs/minute.
author: Anonymous

quote: Software is a great combination of artistry and engineering.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The key to efficient development is to make interesting new mistakes.
author: Anonymous

quote: Good programmers use their brains, but good guidelines save us having to think out every case.
author: Francis Glassborow

quote: The goal of Computer Science is to build something that will last at least until we've finished building it.
author: Anonymous

quote: One of the best programming skills you can have is knowing when to walk away for a while.
author: Oscar Godson

quote: The hardest bugs are those where your mental model of the situation is just wrong, so you can't see the problem at all.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
author: Burt Rutan

quote: The art of debugging is figuring out what you really told your program to do rather than what you thought you told it to do.
author: Andrew Singer

quote: Programming is like sex. One mistake and you have to support it for the rest of your life.
author: Michael Sinz

quote: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third works.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: It's Monday. Time to build something cool!

quote: Coffee in hand, IDE open. Let's make Monday our masterpiece.

quote: Monday is a blank canvas. Paint it with elegant code.

quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it, one line of code at a time.

quote: Today's frustration is tomorrow's 'Eureka!' moment. Keep pushing.

quote: Code is poetry written in logic.

quote: The only bad code is code that's never written. Start typing!

quote: Your code doesn't have to be perfect, it just has to exist. Iterate and improve.

quote: Every line of code is a step towards mastery.

quote: Don't fear Monday, it's just another opportunity to write beautiful code.

quote: Monday: Grab your keyboard and change the world, one function at a time.

quote: Mondays are for moonshots. Dream big, code bigger.

quote: Your code is your legacy. Make it something you're proud of.
author: Anonymous

quote: Complexity is your enemy. Any fool can make something complicated. It is hard to make something simple.

quote: The joy of coding Python should be in seeing short, concise, readable classes that express a lot of action in a small amount of clear code - not in reams of trivial code that bores the reader to death.

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.

quote: The best code is no code at all.

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

quote: Don't worry if it doesn't work right. If everything did, you'd be out of a job.

quote: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

quote: The most important single aspect of software development is to be clear about what you are trying to build.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: Software is like entropy: It is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases.

quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.

quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.

quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.

quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the universe is winning.

quote: The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components are those that aren't there.

quote: The best method for accelerating a computer is the one that boosts it by 9.8 m/s2.

quote: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming; feedback is the treatment.

quote: When to use iterative development? You should use iterative development only on projects that you want to succeed.

quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Programming is not about typing, it's about thinking.
author: Rich Hickey

quote: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: The first 90 percent of the code accounts for the first 90 percent of the development time. The remaining 10 percent of the code accounts for the other 90 percent of the development time.

quote: Plan to throw one away; you will, anyhow.

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong you are only off by a bit.
author: Anonymous

quote: When you don't create things, you become defined by your tastes rather than ability. Your tastes only narrow & exclude people. So create.
author: Why The Lucky Stiff

quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: The great reward of computer programming is the pleasure of working with pure thought-stuff.
author: Jaron Lanier

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.

quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it's too late.

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Theory is when you know something, but it doesn't work. Practice is when something works, but you don't know why. Programmers combine theory and practice: Nothing works and they don't know why.

quote: There are only two kinds of programming languages: those people always bitch about and those nobody uses.

quote: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.

quote: Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature.

quote: Hardware eventually fails. Software eventually works.

quote: It's Monday. The perfect time to reboot your mind and recharge your focus.
author: Anonymous

quote: The code you write makes a developer. The code you delete makes you a good one.

quote: Mondays are the start of the workweek which offer new beginnings 52 times a year!

quote: Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.

quote: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.

quote: The road to success is always under construction.

quote: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.

quote: The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it.

quote: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.

quote: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
